candidates.name: Becs Amundsen
candidates.why_elect: I have proven I am a good leader in our city both before I was on council and since. I am hard working and dedicated to this city. I have had to work hard and learn a lot to get where I am today.
candidates.why_stand: I want to be Mayor to give back to my community and provide much needed leadership. I believe we all have a role to play in determining the city's future and I want to create an environment where people feel welcome and excited about participating in creating the city's vision.

candidates.name: Steve Chernishov
candidates.why_elect: I am an activator, who can action plans and make things happen. I am upbeat and share contagious enthusiasm to get people excited about what really matters. I am focused and fully able to take a direction, follow through and make the corrections to stay on track.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see the council moving beyond providing just basic facilities and managing people—to believing in the people, empowering them, and providing the resources that they need to live their true identity, in freedom, with significance, feeling the love, belonging and having fun.

candidates.name: Darren Ludlow
candidates.why_elect: I'm experienced, professional, well networked (locally and nationally) and can hit the ground in the Mayoral role feet running. I want to inspire confidence in council staff to strive to provide the service council wants, and to help council to better understand its governance role.
candidates.why_stand: After six terms as a councillor I'm highly experienced with issues and processes, but also feel it is time for a more present and hands-on approach to leadership of our council. The Mayor should set a tone, enable, listen and represent the position of council on issues.
